title: Buccaneers 10, Patriots 7 (2nd): Tampa jumps in front
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tampa Bay Buccaneers lead 10-7 against New England Patriots with 7:16 left in the first half.
Patriots rookie Kyle Williams scored a 72-yard touchdown, reaching a speed of 21.78 mph, tying for 7th-fastest in NFL.
Patriots' Terrell Jennings is questionable to return due to a knee injury as the game progresses.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga charged with drunk driving after allegedly crashing into a pole on Oct. 19.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty at Oct. 20 arraignment and was released on personal recognizance, facing charges for OUI and failing to yield.
The officer was placed on modified duty; he's scheduled to appear in court again on Dec. 19, according to court records.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits were detained by ICE during a Nov. 4 raid in Allston, MA.
ICE has not provided information on the detainees' locations; their lawyer struggles to collect necessary case documents.
Rep. Ayanna Pressley and Boston City Councilor Liz Breadon criticized the raid, calling it unjust and cruel.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted the November 8 episode of 'Saturday Night Live' with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser rose to fame in 2024 after standout performances at comedy roasts and the Golden Globes.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue, Pete Davidson's 'Weekend Update,' and Sombr's musical performances.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial insurance goal late in the third period to help Boston Bruins win 5-3 over Toronto.
Minten, former Toronto prospect, was traded to the Bruins in exchange for Brandon Carlo at the 2025 NHL trade deadline.
Bruins secured their sixth consecutive win, marking Minten's third goal of the season amidst high praise from coach Marco Sturm.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame over the weekend in Toronto.
Chara received his Hall of Fame ring on Saturday at the event, with festivities continuing until Monday.
Chara's career included a 2011 Stanley Cup win, seven All-Star selections, and the 2008-09 Norris Trophy.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are predicted to pursue Alex Bregman with 43% of MLB.com voters expecting him to re-sign.
Boston is also seen as a contender for Kyle Schwarber and Pete Alonso, potentially filling key lineup gaps.
Potential pitching targets for the Red Sox include Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez, both considered top free-agent options.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on Nov. 7, 2025, celebrating 20 years since his debut album.
The show featured a mix of songs from his debut 'Get Lifted' and covers, including tracks by The Beatles and Kanye West.
Legend's setlist included 'Prelude', 'Let's Get Lifted', 'All of Me', and concluded with a mix of soul, gospel, and R&B.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating following Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, hinting referee bias in the fourth quarter.
Brown previously criticized refs after a 105-103 loss to the Jazz, alleging a missed foul call on Jazz guard Keyonte George.
Despite his criticism, Brown wasn't fined for his Jazz comments and acknowledged his own shooting struggles against the Magic.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield, an MVP candidate, has completed 63.9% of passes for 1,919 yards, 13 TDs, and two interceptions.
Rookie receiver Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards and five TDs, but struggles against man coverage might affect performance against Patriots.
The Buccaneers' defense ranks seventh in defensive DVOA with standout players like cornerback Jamel Dean and safety Antoine Winfield Jr.
